pullRequest.title: HDDS-3819. OzoneManager#listVolumeByUser ignores userName parameter when ACL is enabled
pullRequest.bodyText:
What changes were proposed in this pull request?
Don't ignore userName input when ACL is enabled for OzoneManager#listVolumeByUser.
What is the link to the Apache JIRA
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HDDS-3819
How was this patch tested?
Fixed existing test TestOzoneManagerListVolumes.

commit.message: Create UGI with userName as input to checkAcls.

nodes.bodyText:
Question for @xiaoyuyao here: UserGroupInformation.createRemoteUser() create a new UGI with AuthMethod.SIMPLE. Does this matter?
IMO in this case only username matters.

commit.message: Fix the existing tests to detect the bug.

nodes.bodyText:
Just a note:
Removing this line enables the existing tests to detect the bug solved by this jira.
You see previously I set the login user to the user I'm calling listVolume with, which unintentionally hides the bug.
